intro: Fenelonia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted fenelonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
